    MessageBox, TestForm, ValidatingModalFormPanel

    public class ModalFormPanel
extends ModalContentPanel
    Class Name : ModalFormPanel Diagram : Wicket Generic Modal Windows Project : Echobase framework Type : concrete Base class for all modal content panels that contain a form.
    Author:
    Chris Colman

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ModalFormPanel(ModalContentWindow iModalContentWindow, IWindowCloseListener iWindowCloseListener)
      Constructs the object passing in a IWindowClosedListener (which can be null if parent is not interested in being notified when the child form is closed).

      • ModalFormPanel

        public ModalFormPanel(ModalContentWindow iModalContentWindow,
              IWindowCloseListener iWindowCloseListener)

    • Method Detail

      • addControlComponents

        public void addControlComponents()
        Adds the button controls to the form. By default OK and Cancel buttons are added but this method can be overridden to add a different button set like YES, NO etc.,

      • setModalResult

        public void setModalResult(int modalResult)
        Sets modalResult

      • getModalResult

        public int getModalResult()
        Returns modalResult

      • updateModel

        public void updateModel()
        Called after form submission with successful validation to update the domain model with data from the form components.

      • show

        public void show(org.apache.wicket.ajax.AjaxRequestTarget target)
        Get the ModalContentWindow to show this ModalContentPanel.
        Overrides:
        show in class ModalContentPanel

      • addFormComponents

        public void addFormComponents()
        Overridden in derived classes to add the form components. Calll form.add to add components, not just add.

      • onCancel

        public void onCancel(org.apache.wicket.ajax.AjaxRequestTarget target)
        Closes the modal window.

      • createForm

        public org.apache.wicket.markup.html.form.Form<?> createForm()
        Creates a Form object. Can be overridden in derived classes to create a form object that extends Form.
